author: Access
title: Treat Acne & Prevent Pimples With These Products | Access
text: The products featured in this article are from brands available in [NBCUniversal Checkout](https://www.accessonline.com/what-is-nbcuniversal-checkout). Access Hollywood makes a commission on purchases. Acne is totally normal, and something we don’t always grow out of. But it can be a major drag! Painful inflamed spots and acne scars can wreak havoc on your face, and your confidence. But if you struggle with mild acne or moderate acne, know that there are plenty of over-the-counter skin care products that can help. Our team of shopping experts has even rounded up the best ones just for you. First, let’s target the cause of your spots. What causes acne? To start, let’s define acne. According to [experts](https://www.niams.nih.gov/health-topics/acne), acne refers to a skin condition that occurs when a build up of oil, sebum, and dead skin cells clog pores and hair follicles. The result is the whiteheads, blackheads, pimples, and cysts we associate with acne. You can experience acne no matter your skin type, however, those with oily skin are more prone to experiencing acne breakouts, [experts](https://www.aad.org/public/diseases/acne/diy/adult-acne-treatment) say. What are the best acne treatments? Regardless of the type of acne you’re experiencing, there’s a product out there to treat acne-prone skin. [Experts](https://www.aad.org/public/diseases/acne/diy/adult-acne-treatment) say that the most effective acne treatment contains the following [key ingredients](https://www.jaad.org/article/S0190-9622%2823%2903389-3/fulltext): - Salicylic Acid: Best for treating inflamed pimples and cysts, clearing pores, and exfoliating skin. - Benzoyl Peroxide: Attacks acne-causing bacteria and prevents oil build up. - Topical Retinoid: The vitamin A derivative can help soothe inflammation, fade hyperpigmentation, and help clear and prevent clogged pores and blackheads. Depending your concern, you’ll want to incorporate some of these ingredients into your skin care routine. Pro tip: Be sure to start out with low dosages and only a few applications a week to help avoid skin irritation, especially if you have sensitive skin. How do I get rid of acne? Since acne is often caused by a build up dirt, grease, and sebum, it’s important to incorporate a gentle cleanser that won’t strip your skin of its natural oils. Contrary to popular belief, [experts say](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3080563/) harsh cleansers won’t minimize oil production. In fact, it’s likely to result in dry skin, which will then overcompensate and produce even more oil to make up for lost moisture. Some options we love are Paula’s Choice acne foaming cream cleanser, which is gentle yet effective in lifting dirt and grime. Targeted treatments – such as La Roche-Posay’s famous Effaclar Duo Acne Treatment with benzoyl peroxide or the salicylic acid pads from First Aid Beauty – are a must after washing your face. And just because you have oily skin doesn’t mean you should skip a moisturizer. Just be sure look for one that’s oil free, like Caudalie’s Vinopure option below. Stop picking at your skin! Trust us, we know it’s tempting, but picking at your pimples or trying to pop them can spread bacteria, leaving behind acne scars and dark spots. If you want help leaving your face alone, invest in pimple patches. They can reduce your urge to pick and make treating stubborn spots so easy (and virtually invisible). Need another avenue to prevent picking? You can apply a spot treatment to your pimples that can help shrink painful pimples overnight, sucking up what’s trapped beneath the skin. This way, you won’t be tempted to squeeze that juicy pimple. Shop our favorite acne treatments Want to clear acne? From spot treatments that soothe angry pimples overnight to gentle cleansers made with oily skin in mind, these are the best products for making your acne disappear. Copyright © 2024 by [NBC Universal, Inc](http://www.nbc.com). All Rights Reserved. This material may not be republished, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed.

author: javimetal71
title: #64 Reino Unido no recuperará las onzas y las libras como medidas: un 98,7% de los británicos están en contra
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
[#2](c2#c-2) Pasa eso porque los medios privados son exclusivamente de derechas, como buena propiedad de multimillonarios que son.
[#30](c30#c-30) y aún nosotros seguimos con las millas marinas,
el DIN A-4 de 210 mmx 297 mm,
los quilates en oro o diamantes
los psig en la presión
el BTU en calderas y calefacciones ...
Aún no me explico cómo ello consintieron en tragar los decibelios.
Menos mal que vino internet con los bit, bytes y kilobytes de 1024 bytes
Ya solo les queda abandonar las millas, las yardas, los pies y las pulgadas y descubrir lo práctico que es el sistema métrico decimal también para longitudes. Que lo de que una pulgada se convierte de 2,54cms, un pie son 12 pulgadas y una yarda 3 pies es algo maravillosamente caótico pero completamente ineficiente.
No termino de entender eso de mezclar nacionalismo con ciencia. Sería maravillosamente distópico que en España siguiésemos usando números romanos en matemáticas porque los otros no nos son tan "naturales".
Se han acostumbrado a lo razonable y nadie quiere volver atrás.
Realmente harían muy bien en medir las distancias en metros y dejarse de chorradas.
Por cierto, que no es algo muy sabido pero los paises con unidades raras en realidad son miembros del sistema métrico internacional. Así pues un foot tiene de largo 0.3048m exactamente (no hay más decimales pues ésta es la definición)
O lo que dice
[#7](c7#c-7) , que da otro número exacto.
[#15](c15#c-15) Todas sus medidas tienen su conversión a sistema métrico, pero sigue siendo un cachondeo, porque una es más o menos 2,5 y la siguiente que tienen ya pasa a 30. Además, es muy gracioso el ver lo imprecisas que son muchas de las mediciones que usan. Lo mítico es que la altura de las personas la midan en pies y pulgadas: un pie son 30,48cm y una pulgada 2,54cm, con lo que para americanos y británicos 1,72, 1,73 y 1,74 pueden terminar siendo el mismo número (5 pies y 8 pulgadas), con lo que los ves redondeando todo el rato o inventándose cosas como la media pulgada para ser un poco más claros.
[#16](c16#c-16) luego los americanos son otros que ya tal.. porque aparte de las imperiales tienen sus propias medidas autóctonas, como las de volumen que una onza puede ser diferente si hablan de líquidos diferentes y más cosas
[#15](c15#c-15) Por supuesto que nadie quiere volver atrás. Es que sólo a un subnormal del culo como Boris Johnson se le podía ocurrir la brillante idea de volver a semejante mierda de sistema.
[#7](c7#c-7) las yardas hace décadas que nadie las usa, y las pulgadas sólo se usan para cosas puntuales, más por tradición que otra cosa.
Los pies lo mismo, sólo se usan en cosas muy puntuales, pero igual que los usamos nosotros, con los contenedores marítimos de 20 y 40 pies, y algunos tipos de tubería los medimos en pulgadas
[#17](c17#c-17) Aguantan más de lo que parece, porque si te paras a pensar la pantalla de los televisiones, monitores y móviles se miden en pulgadas, incluso aquí. Y muchos de los muebles que he visto que vienen de fuera también aparecen en páginas como el Amazon americano con medida en pulgadas y el peso en libras. Y las señales americanas si no me equivoco ponen la distancia en millas, y siempre me ha hecho gracia ver cosas como que una milla son 1760 yardas y 5280 pies porque es difícil de recordar.
Yo siempre lo he visto como un atraso, porque no ofrecen nada más allá de la tradición. En pocas semanas cualquiera se acostumbra a leer que su móvil tiene una pantalla de 15cm y que su tele es de 127 y no le causa ningún trauma.
[#32](c32#c-32) sí eso sí, pero las pulgadas de la tele y demás nos las comemos por los EEUU, el problema de los americanos es que son muy "especialitos" y la mayoría no quiere reconocer que algo de afuera es mejor que lo suyo.
[#18](c18#c-18) En el caso de norteamerica creo recordar q tenia cierta relevancia. Cuando hicieron la parcelacion del pais usaron esas metricas y pasar el sistema decimal podria llevar a disputas territoriales algo que en un pais donde hay mas armas que personas emmm...
[#18](c18#c-18) Y nunca he visto dos pantallas de 15 pulgadas que midan lo mismo.
Supuestamente era el tamaño del tubo antes de meterlo en chasis, pero más bien es una categoría de tamaño.
Igual que nos contenedores internodales. Los hay normales o del doble de longitud. Y nada más. Que tradicionalmente se miran en pues pues es tradicion, al igual que las velocidades de las embarcaciones en nudos.
[#18](c18#c-18) Lo gracioso es que además hay dos tipos de millas en función de si la distancia se mide en la tierra o en el mar.
Milla terrestre: 1,60934 km = 5,280 pies
Milla náutica: 1,852 km = 6076 pies.
Y dejarán de usar electricidad para pasar a máquinas de vapor. Puestos a ir para atrás que al menos monten un parque de atracciones steampunk para que los demás podamos ir de turismo.
[#8](c8#c-8) Luditas: artesanos contra la Revolución Industrial
https://www.muyinteresante.es/historia/59901.html
Justo lo estaba leyendo hace un rato:
https://www.theguardian.com/business/2023/dec/27/pint-of-wine-anyone-uk-looks-to-bring-back-silly-measure
Lo importante es que ahora podraá vender el vino en botellas de una pinta (si quisieran y alguien tuviera interés, que parece ser que no)
[#50](c50#c-50) Claro, "dame dos pounds de eso" es "dame dos libras de eso", o sea, le das una moneda de 2 pounds por ello.
Pero las onzas?
En cualquier caso no es algo que viera habitualmente. En USA usan las onzas hasta para la marihuana. No sé si en algún sitio de UK lo harán también así.
https://www.royalqueenseeds.es/blog-cantidades-de-cannabis-gramo-octavo-cuarto-y-onza-n1199
Yo aquí me pierdo algo. Juraría que en la pérfida albión se sigue pesando en libras, galones, se pesa el body en piedras, las distancias en millas yardas y piés, y demás cosas raras que hacen los british. ¡Si hasta siguen conduciendo por la izquierda!. Y solo hace dos meses de nuestra última visita por aquellos lares.
[#9](c9#c-9) No es en USA donde se hace así?
Lo de las millas sí que se hace en ambos sitios, pero lo de las onzas, etc, yo diría que es en USA.
[#9](c9#c-9) Lo curioso es que el origen de conducir por la izquierda puede remontarse a la invencion de la espada y conducir por la derecha tiene origenes peyorativos;
https://blog.terranea.es/por-que-se-conduce-por-la-izquierda/
[#9](c9#c-9) no, los British tienen un sistema raro. El peso se usa kg, las distancias se hacen en millas y la capacidad en litros o pintas dependiendo de a quien preguntes.
Pues a mi me han contado que en los hospitales el tema de las stones y libras todavía se lleva. Y en verdad algunos envases de leche, por poner un ejemplo, creo que se siguen vendiendo en gallons.
Así que no sé qué se usa y qué no, la verdad.

author: lesoir.com
title: Plaques de glace, gel, neige… la majeure partie du pays en alerte jaune aux conditions glissantes - Le Soir
text:
L’Institut royal météorologique (IRM) a émis jeudi soir une alerte jaune aux conditions glissantes sur l’ensemble du territoire belge, à l’exception de la Côte, jusqu’à vendredi matin. BELGA. Par Belga Publié le 2/01/2025 à 22:02 Temps de lecture: 1 min C ette nuit, la température tombera sous zéro degré dans l’intérieur du pays, annonçant le retour du gel. Des plaques de glace seront par ailleurs à craindre sur des routes encore mouillées par endroits. Une alerte jaune aux conditions glissantes a été émise par l’IRM sur l’ensemble du territoire, à l’exception de la Côte, jusqu’à vendredi matin.
À lire aussi Quand le manque de soleil éclipse le moral
L’IRM prévoit également des averses hivernales sur la moitié nord-est de la Belgique. La neige pourrait ainsi tenir temporairement au sol, même en plaine.
Au vu de ces conditions, l’alerte jaune aux conditions glissantes est prévue jusqu’à 9h00 sur la majeure partie du territoire (sauf la Côte), et jusqu’à 11h00 sur les provinces de Liège, Luxembourg et Namur.
À lire aussi Pourquoi a-t-il fait si sombre en décembre ?

title: DISPENSARY 33 BUDTENDERS JOIN TEAMSTERS LOCAL 777 | Nation & World | djournal.com
text:
Union Continues to Expand Presence in Illinois Cannabis Industry
CHICAGO, Aug. 7, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Cannabis workers at Dispensary 33 have overwhelmingly chosen to join Teamsters Local 777.

author: Sara Sanchez
title: It will be a tricky trade deadline for the Chicago Cubs
text: The Cubs were always a long shot to play meaningful baseball down the stretch, but they’ve really failed to seize the sliver of opportunity. It’s been difficult to watch, honestly. The story of the Cubs season in a nutshell: starting pitching that you can rely on, followed by either the offense or bullpen failing to show up. Early in the season the problem seemed to be more the bullpen’s fault, however, recently the offense has almost entirely vanished. Scoring nine runs in six games isn’t exactly a recipe a recipe for winning baseball. All of it has the Cubs on the cusp of selling one more time at the deadline. This trade deadline poses unique challenges for Jed Hoyer and company, however. It’s not really a full teardown situation and the farm system is much improved, albeit with corner outfielders who are blocked by two stalwarts in the lineup with multiple years left on pretty good deals. Sources have indicated the Cubs will make moves with 2025 and beyond in mind this deadline. But as you’ll see below, so many of the possible tradeable players could also impact the team in 2025 and beyond. So it’s not really clear who exactly the Cubs should trade, nor is it clear what they could get back for the contracts and players they have. With five days until the trade deadline today I wanted to lay out the conundrum this trade deadline and set of contracts poses for the Cubs front office. Let’s start with a look at the 40-man roster, current contracts, and years to free agency. This is mostly a product from [Baseball Prospectus](https://legacy.baseballprospectus.com/compensation/cots/national-league-central/chicago-cubs/) that they complied at the start of the season. I attempted to update it with tracking roster moves and [contract information from Spotrac](https://www.spotrac.com/mlb/player/_/id/24598/david-bote). There is a non-zero chance I’ve missed a name or two (or five!). I apologize for that in advance but think this is a good place to start: Cubs contracts and free agency |Player||Position(s)||Contract||F/A Year| |Player||Position(s)||Contract||F/A Year| |Bellinger, Cody||cf||3 yr/$80M (24-26)||2027| |Swanson, Dansby||ss||7 yr/$177M (23-29)||2029| |Happ, Ian||lf||3 yr/$61M (24-26)||2027| |Suzuki, Seiya||rf||5 yr/$85M (22-26)||2027| |Taillon, Jameson||rhp-s||4 yr/$68M (23-26)||2027| |Hendricks, Kyle||rhp-s||4 yr/$55.5M (20-23)+24 opt||2025| |Hoerner, Nico||2b||3 yr/$35M (24-26)||2027| |Imanaga, Shota||lhp-s||4 yr/$53M (24-27)+opt||2029| |Neris, Hector||rhp||1 yr/$9M (24)+25 cl opt||2026| |Smyly, Drew||lhp||2 yr/$19M (23-24)+25 m opt||2026| |Bote, David||inf||1 yr/$5.1M (24 opt)||2026| |Steele, Justin||lhp-s||1 yr/$4M (24)||2028| |Wisdom, Patrick||3b-1b||1 yr/$2.725M (24)||2027| |Alzolay, Adbert||rhp-s||1 yr/$2.11M (24)||2027| |Tauchman, Mike||cf||1 yr/$1.95M (24)||2027| |Almonte, Yency||rhp||1 yr/$1.9M (24)||2026| |Madrigal, Nick||2b||1 yr/$1.81M (24)||2027| |Leiter Jr., Mark||rhp||1 yr/$1.5M (24)||2027| |Merryweather, Julian||rhp||1 yr/$1.175M (24)||2027| |Morel, Christopher||3b||1 yr/$767,000 (24)||2029| |Assad, Javier||rhp||1 yr/$755,000 (24)||2029| |Amaya, Miguel||c||1 yr/$746,500 (24)| |Mastrobuoni, Miles||2b||1 yr/$746,000 (24)| |Busch, Michael||2b||1 yr/$741,500 (24)| |Wicks, Jordan||lhp||1 yr/$741,500 (24)| |Kilian, Caleb||rhp||1 yr/$740,500 (24)| |Little, Luke||lhp||1 yr/$740,500 (24)| |Alcántara, Kevin||of||1 yr (24)| |Arias, Michael||rhp||1 yr (24)| |Brown, Ben||rhp||1 yr (24)| |Canario, Alexander||of||1 yr (24)| |Crow-Armstrong, Pete||of||1 yr (24)| |Davis, Brennen||of||1 yr (24)| |Hodge, Porter||rhp||1 yr (24)| |Mervis, Matt||1b||1 yr (24)| |Palencia, Daniel||rhp||1 yr (24)| |Thompson, Keegan||rhp||1 yr (24)| |Vazquez, Luis||ss||1 yr (24)| |Wesneski, Hayden||rhp-s||1 yr (24)| |Lopez, Jorge||rhp||1 yr (24)| |Miller, Tyson||rhp||1 yr (24)| |Nido, Tomás||c||1 yr (24)| |Bigge, Hunter||rhp||1 yr (24)| |Brewer, Colton||rhp||1 yr (24)| |Roberts, Ethan||rhp||1 yr (24)| |Tinoco, Jesus||rhp||1 yr (24)| Some notes on reading this table, players who are pre-arbitration and still have years of control are listed as one-year deals. Players who have had their service time hit one year have a definitive free agent date, while rookies may not. A handful of players have some truly quirky things going on like player options or innings targets where options vest. I could not include all of that in this table and make it legible. I’m happy to answer any questions about methodology, but will just concede upfront that I may have missed a thing or two (or five!). First things first, the contracts that are most likely to be moved during any trade deadline are players committed for a single season who are over-performing their expectations or are at least close to their contract value. To that end, I’ve highlighted the players who are on single-year expiring contracts. Those players are: Kyle Hendricks, Héctor Neris, Drew Smyly and David Bote. To say these players are having seasons that are unlikely to return much from a free agency standpoint is an understatement. I expect at least Neris and Smyly to be moved, however both have clauses in their contracts that could make that challenging. Neris has an option year that vests with the following terms, [according to Spotrac](https://www.spotrac.com/mlb/player/_/id/16572/hector-neris#:~:text=Hector%20Neris%20signed%20a%201,a%20total%20salary%20of%20%249%2C000%2C000.): 60 appearances in 2024 OR 45 games finished in 2024 AND player is not on the IL at the final game AND player does not have a long-term injury at season end Neris has already appeared in 38 games for those keeping track at home, so any team who wants him to be impactful for their team down the stretch could be locking themselves into his option. Smyly is less likely to hit his innings bonuses and does not have an option. They are innings based and he’s currently 38⅔ innings pitched, but for consistency’s sake they are below: Annual Bonuses (Innings Pitched) (2024 escalated $2M) $250,000 each for 110, 120 $750,000 each for 130, 140 $1M for 150. Additionally, let’s just be very clear none of these players is returning all that much on the trade front. Moving them allows prospects who could impact the roster in 2025 or beyond to the active roster. That’s it. Second, there are a series of contracts with a year or two remaining on their deals. Players like this are occasionally moved at the deadline, especially when they are on team-friendly deals. For example, one of the better prospect hauls in recent memory was the Minnesota Twins dealing José Berríos (who had 15-months left before free agency) to the Toronto Blue Jays for two of their top prospects in Austin Martin and Simeon Woods-Richardson. That is a prospect haul that most baseball types thought was excellent. The Cubs would be lucky to turn any of the players below into a similar return. [Twins Daily revisited that trade recently](https://twinsdaily.com/news-rumors/minnesota-twins/trade-review-twins-blue-jays-jose-berrios-austin-martin-simeon-woods-richardson/) and it’s a really good reminder that prospects are not promises. With that massive caveat in mind, in looking at the contracts that live in the multiple years and maybe have the correct value tier, you’ll find the following players: Jameson Taillon (2+ years of control remaining), Nico Hoerner (2+ years of control remaining), Julian Merryweather (2+ years of control remaining), Mark Leiter Jr. (2+ years of control remaining). Two other players who could live in this tier but are distinct: Ian Happ also has 2+ years remaining, however a no-trade clause complicates any deal there. Additionally, Cody Bellinger has player options. However, there are real questions as to whether Bellinger or Happ are performing to the Annual Average Value level of their deals. And therein lies the rub, The Cubs have some interesting guys they could potentially move. They have some players that teams might even want for multiple years. However if the contract still has too much guaranteed money associated with it, the Cubs front office will need to either 1) pay down the value of the contract to get a better prospect return or 2) accept lesser valued prospects in return for players who are performing relatively well. There really isn’t an easy match for a one-year deal relievers who are crushing it that can be flipped a la Craig Kimbrel. Trading Nico Hoerner right now might be possible, but does anyone think his peak value is a .257/.335/.351 slashline with 14 steals in 95 games? Truly, only Jameson Taillon, Julian Merryweather and Mark Leiter Jr. have the type of value and years remaining that could warrant a large prospect haul — and they are all also pitchers who absolutely could impact the Cubs positively in 2025 and beyond. One final note, I’m sure the comments will suggest trading from the slew of players who are pre-arbitration. Honestly, unless the Cubs are interested in parting ways with Michael Busch at peak value rather than see his team-controlled years play out with the Chicago Cubs, any of those deals would be selling pretty low on players too. I’m sure someone is going to suggest flipping Christopher Morel because you are frustrated with him. It would be exceedingly rare for a team to cut bait on a 25-year-old who has 35+ home run potential while he’s struggling. In fact, it’s a really good way to regret a trade in the future.

author: I. de la Fuente
title: El frío se recrudece a las puertas del fin de semana en estas zonas de Castilla y León, según la Aemet
text:
Meteorología
El frío se recrudece a las puertas del fin de semana en estas zonas de Castilla y León, según la Aemet
Las temperaturas se mantienen estables con un ligero incremento de las máximas y mínimas bajo cero en la mayor parte de la comunidad
La Agencia Estatal de Meteorología (Aemet) mantiene para este viernes los avisos amarillos por bajas temperaturas en zona de montaña de las provincias de Burgos y León. E
En concreto, en puntos de la Cordillera Cantábrica, en el caso de León, y en zonas de Ibérica, en Burgos, se podrían registrar hasta seis grados bajo cero.
El frío se recrudece según avanza la semana. Ayer, la estación de esquí de La Covatilla (Salamanca), con seis grados bajo cero, por delante de Pedrosillo de Los Aires (Salamanca), con -5,6 grados y de el Puerto del Pico (Ávila), con -5,3 grados.
La previsión del tiempo de la Aemet para hoy habla de que el día amanecerá nuboso, con brumas y bancos de niebla matinales, y con probabilidad de precipitaciones en la mitad sur, débiles en general, y que pueden ser engelantes en algún punto disperso por la mañana.
La cota de nieve se sitúa sobre los mil o 1.200 metros. Los vientos soplarán del sureste o variables tendiendo a componente oeste, y serán flojos.
Respecto a las temperaturas, se mantendrán estables con un ligero incremento de las máximas en el extremo suroeste. Entre las capitales de provincia los termómetros se moverán mañana entre los diez grados de Salamanca y los siete de Ávila, León y Soria, aunque las mínimas caerán hasta los tres bajo cero en León capital.
No se esperan lluvias aunque en la provincia de Soria hay un 65 por ciento de posibilidades de que caiga algo de agua en Arcos de Jalón durante las horas centrales del día o en Almazán.

author: Bruce Campbell | Enid News & Eagle
title: OBA's Colby signs with John Brown
text:
ENID, Okla. — Brianna Colby’s legacy at Oklahoma Bible Academy will be her intensity and competitiveness.
“She might be the hardest-working kid that I have ever had on the court in games and in practice,” said Lady Trojan basketball coach Randy Roth before Colby signed with NAIA John Brown Tuesday. “She gave me everything that she had. It’s a rare thing to have that all of the time … the thing I will miss the most about her was the joy she had for her teammates and the sport.”

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Texas Health Alert. Gut Bacteria Fueled by Fiber Could Lower Diabetes Risk. Doctor Explains
text:
By The Health Standard Newswire ,
1 day ago In this article, Dr. Shelandra Bell, Family Medicine, shares her expert insights of the findings and provides Texas residents with evidence-based recommendations for protecting their health.
Why This Matters to You New research is showing that eating more dietary fiber can help reduce the risk of Type 2 diabetes by encouraging the growth of good gut bacteria and beneficial metabolites.
What This Means for Your Health "...mom continues to be correct. Eat your fiber!" Dr. Puja Uppal, Family Medicine
Doctor's Expert Insights About The Impact of Dietary Fiber and Gut Health Know this: "For those looking to cut their risk of developing Type 2 diabetes, eating more dietary fiber should be a good start. Fiber found in fruits, veggies, nuts, and whole grains doesn't just keep your digestive system running smoothly--it also feeds the good bacteria in your gut. These bacteria, in turn, produce helpful substances that our bodies can use." Dr. Shelandra Bell, Family Medicine.
Actionable Steps: What You Can Do Next
Know your A1c blood levels. Schedule a colonoscopy if you're 45 years and older--do it sooner if you have any family relatives who've had colon cancer in their past. The CDC has a comprehensive page about these new guidelines. ( Visit Here ) Most insurances in Texas will cover this colonoscopy. Health News Today: Fiber may reduce diabetes risk through its impact on gut bacteria and metabolites.
This new study investigates the complex relationships between dietary fiber intake, gut microbiota, circulating metabolites, and their potential roles in the development of type 2 diabetes (T2D) in a U.S. Hispanic/Latino population.
The Science Made Simple: Key Findings and What They Mean for Texas Residents Dietary fiber intake and type 2 diabetes (T2D) risk: Eating more dietary fiber was linked to a lower risk of developing T2D over 6 years. They found that people who ate the more fiber had a 29% lower chance of getting T2D--when compared to those who ate the least fiber.
Dietary fiber intake, gut bacteria, and T2D: 24 types of gut bacteria were related to fiber intake, and 9 of these were also related to T2D. Some species of bacteria (Butyrivibrio, Faecalibacterium, Roseburia, Ruminococcus, and Marvinbryantia) were found more in people who ate more fiber and less in people with T2D.
Different bacteria (Acidaminococcus, Erysipelatoclostridium, Hungatella, and Lachnoclostridium) were found less in people who ate more fiber and more in people with T2D.
Simply put, the study found that certain gut bacteria were affected by the amount of fiber people ate, and these bacteria were also related to whether someone had T2D or not.
Dietary fiber intake, gut bacterial enzymes, and T2D: Enzymes that break down fiber and were found more in people who ate more fiber were found less in people with T2D. Gut bacteria produce enzymes that help digest fiber, and the study found that these enzymes were affected by fiber intake and also related to T2D.
Combining gut bacteria and blood metabolite data: 18 metabolites in the blood were found to be related to both fiber intake and T2D, and also to specific gut bacteria. The study found connections between specific bacteria, molecules, and T2D risk.
Blood metabolites may explain links between gut bacteria and T2D: The relationships between some gut bacteria (Faecalibacterium, Butyrivibrio, Acidaminococcus, and Lachnoclostridium) and T2D became weaker when considering their related metabolites. The study suggests that certain gut bacteria may affect T2D risk through the molecules/byproducts they produce.
Predicting T2D risk using gut bacteria and blood metabolites: Using blood metabolites as stand-ins for gut bacteria, the study suggested that Butyrivibrio and Lachnoclostridium bacteria might be related to increased T2D risk. By analyzing the relationships between gut bacteria and blood molecules, the study found clues that certain bacteria could help predict someone's risk of developing T2D in the future.
Conclusion: The study shows that eating more dietary fiber is linked to healthier gut bacteria, bacterial functions, and blood molecule profiles. All these components are related to a lower risk of T2D. Keep in mind this study looked at a U.S. Hispanic/Latino population--as such, broader studies will need to be conducted. In the short term, fiber's beneficial role in promoting a healthy diet is well-established.
Medical News Today: What This Means for Your Health in Texas The Bottom Line: The findings help us better understand the complex relationships between dietary fiber, gut bacteria, and blood molecules, and how they may influence the development of T2D.
"Consistent evidence suggests diabetes-protective effects of dietary fiber intake, but exactly how that protection occurs remains unclear." Zheng Wang, PhD. (Study Editorial)
What They're Saying: "Our study revealed that Faecalibacterium was associated with multiple potentially beneficial metabolites in serum, including indolepropionate, 3-phenylpropionate, and cinnamoylglycine, all linked to higher fiber intake and lower risk of T2D. Our findings are consistent with the reported beneficial role of indolepropionate in antiinflammation, antioxidant activity, and amelioration of glucose metabolism." (Study Source)
Health Standard Newswire : Fiber Intake Shapes Beneficial Bacteria and Metabolites.
Health Facts That Matter: Key Statistics for Harris County, Texas The following health facts impact your physical health directly! Did you know there were 8136 deaths from diabetes in Texas in 2021? 37.7% of you in Harris County are obese. 18.4% of you in Harris County have depression. 33.7% of you in Harris County are sleeping less than 7 hours per night. All of these variables above play an important role in the outcomes of your overall health.
The Health Standard Newswire.
Expand All Read in NewsBreak

author: Par Sofiane Mehenni
title: Afrique: CAN2023 - Hubert Velud « J'ai plusieurs raisons pour battre l'Algérie..» - allAfrica.com
text:
En conférence de presse, le sélectionneur des étalons du Burkina- Faso, Hubert Velud est très confiant pour battre l'Algérie demain au stade de la paix à Bouaké pour le compte de la deuxième journée du groupe D.
ATS : Quel est votre état d'esprit pour le match de demain face à l'Algérie ?
C'est un Match très important face à l'Algérie, un grand d'Afrique, de grands noms. Après ce n'est pas une finale de groupe. Mon état d'esprit est guidé sur l'aspect du match. Il sera différent du premier. L'Algérie a fait une très bonne première mi-temps, il y aurait pu y avoir 2 ou 3-0. On va assister à un grand match, une belle opposition de style. En tous cas, on n'est pas trop dans le calcul, moi je suis un instinctif. En phase de groupe il faut parfois être calculateur mais sur ce match ça ne sera pas trop le cas
ATS : Vous allez jouer à 14h, cet horaire ne va pas handicaper vos joueurs ?
Jouer à 14H, c'est comme ça, c'est l'Afrique. Il faut s'organiser. Ca peut handicaper certaines équipes mais ne nous on y pense pas même si c'est une question importante. Déjà qu'on ait disputé le premier match face à la Mauritanie dans la même heure.
ATS : Selon vous, les algériens vont se livrer demain ou ils vont fermer le jeu pour vous surprendre derrière ?
Je ne pense pas que l'Algérie va nous attendre pour nous contrer. Ce n'est pas leur style. Nous on est plus modulables. , On n'a pas de pression. Les algériens ont des attaquants très forts mais on est prêts.
% Etes-vous les favoris pour cette rencontre ?
On ne peut pas dire qu'on est favoris face à l'Algérie, on est peut être a égalité. Par rapport à nos dernières confrontations, on sait qu'on doit progresser et le plus important c'est de bien négocier cette rencontre.
ATS: Tout le monde est prêt pou demain?
Nous n'avons pas de blessés, dieu merci. Traoré Bertrand Traoré n'a peut être pas 90 minutes dans les jambes mais il est prêt pour le match.
ATS : Le match de l'Algérie est spécial pour vous pour plusieurs raisons, n'est- ce- pas ?
J'ai entrainé pendant plusieurs années la bas, donc j'ai beaucoup d'affection pour l'Algérie, je connais bien la mentalité. Mais je mettrai ça de côté tout comme mes deux adjoints algériens Hichem Boumbar et Riadh Belkhir. Toutefois, j'ai plusieurs raisons pour battre l'Algérie.
ATS : Justement, vous avez entrainé un certain Youcef Belaili avec l'USM Alger, on imagine que connaissez mieux que quiconque ce joueur...
Belaili je l'ai vu naitre footballistiquement à l'USMA, son premier grand club. C'est quelqu'un d'adorable humainement, donc je serai très content de le retrouver. C'est une des grandes forces de l'Algérie, j'espère qu'il ne sera pas très méchant avec moi....
Cliquez ici pour lire l'article sur le site d'Africa Top Sports.
